en: The Boomstick
Creates an explosion when an enemy dies.
Frankly a misuse of the tool but if they didn't want it to be a bomb they shouldn't have given it that name.
Grapeshot
Fires a spread of low damaging fruity bullets every third attack.
A good soldier can turn anything into a weapon, and makes a nasty adversary at a cafeteria food fight.
Force Field
Summons a protective shield that spins around you and can slam into enemies.
Generally considered a weak weapon in any situation involving bugs.
Bomb of Revenge
Explodes whenever you take damage, knocking foes away.
Note: Do not go out of way to activate! Is very uncomfortable. Frankly how it manages to devastate the enemies but not hurt me is beyond my understanding.
Alarming Totem
Gain a temporary 30% speed boost when you kill an enemy.
It's engravings showcase, specifically, a bird. Probably a hawk or eagle or something. Definitely NOT a snail. Frankly I'm not sure how one could confuse it as such.
Dream Car
Groovy! Oh yeah this lets you dash more frequently I think.

[fade start=40 length=240]Characterized by thin roof pillars, fastback styling and implied aerodynamics, it symbolized 1960s Jet Age design. The '60 and '61 Models shared their roof lines and chassis, with the 1961 Model featuring substantially revised front and rear styling.[/fade]
Gravity's Gauntlet
Pulls enemys towards you making them easier to hit.
This gauntlet, created by Sir Gravity himself, harnesses the power of Magnetism to bring your foes into striking distance.
Soul Harvester
Temporary power boost after you kill an enemy.
You're not actually taking their souls, they dont have any! [size=14]Probably...[/size]
Lean Aura
Gives you higher attack speed and damage but makes enemys hit harder and move faster
The power of lean gives you much more power in the brawn department but not the brain department, enemys can feel your brainrot
